Name: Stela of Tjet
Description: In the lunette of this tall rectangular stela are two udjat-eyes. Underneath them are three lines of text containing the offering formula. On the left of the first register, a man is standing. He is facing a kneeling and a standing woman on the right. Each holds a lotus flower in her hand. In front of the women is a mat with several offerings on it. The lower part of the stela is taken up by an inscription of ten columns of text reading from left to right. Here and there traces of blue paint are visible.
